titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary” / Täʾamrä Iyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” / Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq... “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…” / Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 1ra-7vb, 88ra) I-2) Introductory exhortation (fols. 8ra-11va) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki... “I worship Thee…” (fols. 11va-12vb) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 76 Miracles (fols. 13ra-125vb) II) Täʾamrä ʾIyasus "Miracles of Jesus": 6 miracles (fols. 126ra-138vb, 144ra-144vb), the last miracle incomplete III) Täʾamrä Qirqos "Miracles of Cyricus": 4 miracles (fols. 139ra-141vb) IV) Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq... “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…” (fol. 143ra) V) Täʾamrä Libanos "Miracles of Libanos": 1 miracle (fols. 143ra-144ra)
Additio 1; colophon.

copyists.copyist: Zä-Wäldä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formulas on fols. 121vb, 124vb and 125vb. He might be the same scribe as that of Ms. QMM-011. Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe is mentioned as the scribe on fol. 138r.

donors.donor: The names of ʿAmdä Mäsqäl and ʾAwad are written in the supplications formulas in quires XI-XIII, in hand a. Further names are mentioned in the concluding formula on fol. 125vb: Gäbrä Dǝngǝl, ʿAsbä Maryam, ʿAmdä Giyorgis. Wälättä Krǝstos is mentioned in the supplications formulas in quires XIV-XV, in hand b. In addition, Kǝflä Maryam is mentioned as the commissioner on fol. 138r. ʾAbunä Kǝflä Maryam is also mentioned in the supplication formulas in quire XVI.

txstates.txstate: The manuscript is very worn and damaged. A part of each board is broken off. The Ms. has been rebound, probably more than once. Text I (quires I-XIII) might have previously been preserved in two codices. The last quire consists of several folios originating from different codices. All quires are reinforced with parchment guards. Some fols. are misplaced (e.g, fols. 46, 142). Holes and tears are carefully amended on fols. 29, 31, 34, 36, 83, 93, 101, 102, 110, 125, 141. 2/3 of fol. 138 is cut off. Fol. 142 is cut in the outer and bottom margin.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken). Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: ˂፩I(7/fols. 1r-7v) ˃ – [፪]II(7/fols. 8r-14v) – ፫III(8/fols. 15r-22v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 23r-30v) – ፭V(8/fols. 31r-38v) – ፮VI(7/fols. 39r-45v) – VII(11/fols. 46r-56v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – ፱IX(11/fols. 65r-75v) – ፲X(12/fols. 76r-87v) – ˂፩/፪/፫XI(16/fols. 88r-104v) – ፪/፬/፭XII(13/fols. 105r-117v) – ፫/፮/፬XIII(8/fols. 118r-125v) ˃ – ˂XIV(6/fols. 126r-132v) – XV(6/fols. 133r-138v)˃ – ˂XVI(6/fols. 139r-144v)˃

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: fols. 1r-7v: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B!. fols. 8r-125v: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A (s. fol. 39r). Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B!. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre but careful Hand b: mediocre Hand c: irregular

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a (Zä-Wäldä Maryam): quire I-XIII (Text I); rounded script with wide, broadly spaced letters. Some letters have a big circular vowel marker (e.g., ሎ ቤ ግ). Hand b (Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe): quires XIV-XV (Text II); angular script. Hand c: quire XVI (Texts III-V); probably different hands.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሰ fofol. 7rb-va: ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ fol. 88ra: ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ r ሰላም (s. fol. 143, l.2)

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text I-2 includes the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam ... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary ..." (fol. 10ra-rb) - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fol. 10rb-va l.9) (cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan... "Salutation to you, o my Lady Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 10va l.9-11va). The miracles of Mary (Text I-4) are numbered.

desccontent.details:
I-1) Mäṣḥafä śərˁat, Introductory rite of al-Muˁallaqah;
I-2) Introductory exhortation;
I-3) ˀƎsäggəd läki wä-ˀəweddəsäki “I Worship Thee…”;
I-4) 76 miracles of Mary.

desccontent.text: I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat – Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
desccontent.mss: Lady Meux 3 (18th cent.), fol. 2r-4v; BritMus Orient. 8814 (18th cent.), fols. 86ra-92v (StrBritLib 46, no 32).

edition.text: BMirMA 2-4. TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚǝLLASE (ed.), Täʾamrä Maryam, Addis Abäba 1961 E.C., 9-10, 11-20. BHMirM xlvi-liv.

desccontent.itranslation: [Fol. 1ra, l.1] In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the seat of Mark the Apostle, from the church of Mäˁalqa (al-Muˁallaqah) of Məsr (i.e. Cairo) wherein the doctors, the glorious patriarchs, the treasurers of the mystery, the righteous had laid it up.

desccontent.mss: O Etiop. 11, fols. 12-14aa (LöfUpp 88, no. 30-D, "Zweite Einleitung"). Lady Meux 2 (16th cent.), fol. 1. Lady Meux 3 (18th cent.), fol. 5r-7r.

edition.text: BMirMA 1-2, 5-6. TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚǝLLASE (ed.), Täʾamrä Maryam, Addis Abäba 1961 E.C., 3-7. BHMirM xliii-xlv.

desccontent.itranslation: [Fol. 8ra, l.1]: The foreword of the miracles which to be read during the Christian Sunday. We will tell you, our brothers, children of the church, may God bless you and enlighten the eyes of your hearts to listen to the miracles of our Lady Mary, the holy and twofold Virgin.

desccontent.text: I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki “I worship Thee…”
desccontent.author: ascribed to John Chrysostom
desccontent.mss: O Etiop. 11, fols. 11a/b (LöfUpp 88, no. 30-C) Lady Meux 3 (18th cent.), fol. 7r-7v.

edition.text: BMirMA 6-7. TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚǝLLASE (ed.), Täʾamrä Maryam, Addis Abäba 1961 E.C.,7-9. BHMirM lvi-lvii.

desccontent.details:
I-3)-1: Fols. 13ra-14vb: About Ildefonsus (Däqəsyos) of Toledo (Ṭəlṭəlyaya)

(BMirMA 10-12; BHMirM 1-4; CerMaria 310-316; ColMirM 23-24 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-7; éth. 60, fols. 8-10, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-1; Orient. 8814, fols. 98r-100v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-1).

I-3)-2: Fols. 15ra-15rb: End of an undefined miracle.

I-3)-3. Fols. 15rb-16va: The Virgin Mary protects a pregnant woman from drowning during the feast of St. Michael (ColMirM 50-51).

I-3)-4. Fols. 16va-19rb: The Virgin Mary and the cannibal of Qəmər (BMirMA 46-47; BHMirM 94-97; ColMirM 176-180 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 102, no. 32, I, D.-29; éth. 60, fols. 49-52, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-30; Orient. 8814, fols. 156v-160r, StrBritLib 48, no. 32, 16.-29).

I-3)-5. Fols. 19rb-19vb: The death of Nestorius (CerMaria 213-215 // mss.  d´Abbadie 165, fols. 100r-100v, CRAbb 82, no. 52; d´Abbadie 222, fols. 45v-46r, CRAbb 85, no. 53; Vat. Et. 43, fols. 232-333, GréTisVat I 188, no. 43).

I-3)-6. Fols. 19vb-20va: About three virgins who served Mary (mss. d´Abbadie 165, fols. 99v-100r, CRAbb 82, no. 52).

I-3)-7. Fols. 20va-21rb: The spring of Məḥṣab, part of the Synaxarium of 8 Säne (GuiSyn I 568-570, CerMaria 29, 37 // mss. éth. 60, fols. 147v-148, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-85; éth. 62, fols. 38v-39v, ZotBNat 68, no. 60-25; O Ethiop. 11, LöfUpp 89, no. 30, F.-6).

I-3)-8. Fols. 21rb-22rb: The Virgin Mary, on a chariot with her son and crowned with pearls, appeared to the Apostles.

I-3)-9. Fols. 22rb-22vb: Apparition of Mary to John Chrysostom (mss. éth. 60, fols. 173v-174, ZotBNat 67, no. 60-104).

I-3)-10. Fols. 23ra-24vb: Miracle of the sycamore at Däbrä Məṭmaq (mss. éth. 60, fols. 135v-137v, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-79).

I-3)-11. Fols. 24vb-27va:The Virgin Mary cursed an Egyptian woman who did not want to give them water (mss. éth. 60, fols. 144v-147v, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-84).

I-3)-12. Fols. 27va-29ra: The Virgin Mary destroyed an Egyptian town whose inhabitants did not accommodate the holy family well (mss. éth. 60, fols. 137v-139, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-80).

I-3)-13. Fols. 29ra-30rb: The Virgin Mary cursed inhabitants of an Egyptian town in turning them into baboons (mss. éth. 60, fols. 140v-142, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-82).

I-3)-14. Fols. 30va-32va: About the king of an Egyptian town who invited the Virgin Mary and three thousand inhabitants were cured (mss. éth. 60, fols. 142-144, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-83).

I-3)-15. Fols. 32va-33ra: The Virgin Mary appeared to a poor monk who had no food and clothes who prays her every day.

I-3)-16. Fols. 33ra-33vb: The Virgin Mary and the workman (BMirMA 13; BHMirM 6-7 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-9; éth. 60, fols. 11-12, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-3; Orient. 8814, fols. 100v-101r, StrBritLib 46, no. 32,16.-2).

I-3)-17. Fols. 33vb-34va: The Jew of the city of Akhmim (BMirMA 14; BHMirM 8-9; CerMaria 219-225; ColMirM 452-453 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-10; éth. 60, fols. 12-13, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-4; Orient. 8814, fols. 101r-103v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-3).

I-3)-18. Fols. 34va-35rb: The Virgin Mary and the scribe Damianus (Dəmyanos) of Philippi (Fələṗäsyos) (BMirMA 15; BHMirM 10-13; ColMirM 512 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-11; éth. 60, fols. 13-14, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-5; Orient. 8814, fols. 103v-104v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-4).

I-3)-19. Fols. 35rb-36ra: The Virgin Mary and bishop ˀAbbas (the pope Leon) (BMirMA 14-16; BHMirM 14-16; CerMaria 436-444 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-12; éth. 60, fols. 14-15v, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-6; Orient. 8814, fols. 104v-106v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-5).

I-3)-20. Fols. 36ra-37ra: The Virgin Mary and monk Isaac (BMirMA 17-18; BHMirM 20-22; ColMirM 265-273 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-13; éth. 60, fols. 15v-17, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-7; Orient. 8814, fols. 106v-108v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-6).

I-3)-21. Fols. 37va-38rb: The Virgin Mary and the child Mary of Däfra (BHMirM 23-25; BMirMA 18-19; CerMaria 191-194 // mss. éth. 60, fols. 17-18, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-8; Orient. 8814, fols. 108v-110v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32-7).

I-3)-22. Fols. 38rb-39rb: The Virgin Mary and the painter decorating a church in France (hagärä Afransa) (BMirMA 19-20; BHMirM 26-32 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-15; éth. 60, fols. 18-19v, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-9; Orient. 8814, fols. 110v-112v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-8).

I-3)-23. Fols. 39rb-39vb: The Virgin Mary and the sick monk in the ‟Monastery of Pilgers” (Däbrä Näggadəyan) (BMirMA 20-21; BHMirM 33-34; CerMaria 192 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-16; éth. 60, fols. 19v-20v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-10; Orient. 8814, fols. 112v-114r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-9).

I-3)-24. Fols. 39vb-41ra: The Virgin Mary and the youth Zachary (BMirMA 21-22; BHMirM 35-37; ColMirM 85-86 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-1; éth. 60, fols. 20v-22v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-11; Orient. 8814, fols. 114r-117v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-10).

I-3)-25. Fols. 41ra-42rb: The two women, the robbers and the flute.

I-3)-26. Fols. 42rb-43ra: The Virgin Mary and the church of ˁƎqona, which was moved to the edge of the sea (BMirMA 25; BHMirM 45-46; ColMirM 171// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-4; éth. 60, fols. 24v-25v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-14; Orient. 8814, fols.121v-123v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-13).

I-3)-27. Fols. 43ra-44ra: The Virgin Mary and the blind Egyptian Priest John Bäkänsi (BMirMA 26-27; BHMirM 47-49; ColMirM 283-284// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-5; éth. 60, fols. 25v-27, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-15; Orient. 8814, fols. 123v-126r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-14).

I-3)-28. Fols. 44ra-45vb: The Virgin Mary and the man of the island of Qwäläsyəs who had a dart in his eye (BMirMA 28-29; BHMirM 53-55; ColMirM 285-286 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-6; éth. 60, fols. 27-28, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-16; Orient. 8814, fols. 126r-128r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-15).

I-3)-29. Fols. 44vb-46ra: The Virgin Mary and the blind girl Elisabeth of Bädrəman (BMirMA 27-28; BHMirM 53-56; ColMirM 185-186 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-18; éth. 60, fols. 28-30, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-17; Orient. 8814, fols. 128r-131r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-16).

I-3)-30. Fols. 46ra-46vb: The Virgin Mary and Bishop Mercurius (BMirMA 36-37; BHMirM 71-72; ColMirM 287-288 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-24; éth. 60, fols. 37v-38v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-24; Orient. 8814, fols. 142r-144r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-23).

I-3)-31. Fol. 46vb-47va: The Virgin Mary and the epileptic (BMirMA 275 variation).

I-3)-32. Fols. 47va-48vb: The Virgin Mary and the governor ˀArmatyas of Ephesus (ColMirM 188-189 // mss. d´Abbadie 222, fols. 59v-60v, CRAbb 85, no. 53-XL).

I-3)-33. Fols. 48vb-49rb: The Virgin Mary and the priest John of the monastery of Macarius (Mäqarəs) (ColMirM 337).

I-3)-34. Fols. 49rb-50rb: The resurrection of the son of a rich man of Cappadocia (Qäpdäqya) (ColMirM 130).

I-3)-35. Fols 50rb-51rb: The Virgin Mary and the thirsty dog (BMirMA 51-52; BHMirM 112 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 102, no. 32, I, D.-32; éth. 60, fols. 56-57, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-33; Orient. 8814, fols. 165v-167v, StrBritLib 48, no. 32, 16.-32).

I-3)-36. Fols. 51rb-54va: The Virgin Mary and the holy communion in Cyprus (E. Cerulli, “Two Ethiopian Tales on the Christian of Cyprus”, JES 5-1: 1-4; EAE I “Cyprus”).

I-3)-37. Fols. 54va-56ra: The young man and the image of the Virgin placed on the gate of the town, on which she lowered her head each time he prostrated in front of it.

I-3)-38. Fols. 56ra-57rb: The Virgin Mary and the beekeeper (BHMirM 341-342).

I-3)-39. Fols. 57rb-58rb: The journey of a pious knight on the skies.

I-3)-40. Fols. 58rb-59va: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to a sinful deacon in “the town of the island”.

I-3)-41. Fols. 59va-61rb: Isaac, son of king of Roma Mäsfənyos and of his wife Səfəngya (mss. d´Abbadie 165, fols. 62v-63v, CRAbb 80, no. 52-LVII; O Eth. 11, LöfUpp 93, no. 30-51).

I-3)-42. Fols. 61rb-62vb: Daniel of Constantinople and an image of the Virgin Mary.

I-3)-43. Fols. 62vb-63va: Andrew and Bartholomew and the priest ploughing his land on Sunday.

I-3)-44. Fols. 63va-65ra: How the Virgin Mary showed everything they want to people assembled in Däbrä Məṭmaq (ColMirM 208-210).

I-3)-45. Fols. 65ra-66ra: The Virgin Mary showed hell and heaven to a Roman (Romawi) monk of Däbrä Kwuzara called ˁOṣ (mss. éth. 60, fols. 130-131, ZotBNat 65, no. 60-73).

I-3)-46. Fols. 66ra-68vb: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to Ephraim the Potter (The Syrian) (ColMirM 373-375).

I-3)-47. Fols. 68vb-69rb: The Virgin Mary and the three monks of Toledo.

I-3)-48. Fols. 69rb-70ra: The great sadness of the Virgin Mary: Miracle read during the Good Friday (Gəbrä Ḥəmamat, zäˁarb, Addis Abäba, 1942 E.C., p. 271).

I-3)-49. Fols. 70ra-70va: Jesus Christ and angels will judge the whole world in a church dedicated to the Virgin Mary and located in the valley of Josaphat (Yosafəṭ) of Jerusalem (mss. EMML 4618, fols. 125v, EMML X 239 no 4618-98; EMML 5492, fols. 24v // EAE II Däbrä Ṣəyon).

I-3)-50. Fols. 70va-71vb: The celibacy of MarK, king of Rome, son of king Gäbrä Iyasus and the picture of Mary (ColMirM 73-75).

I-3)-51. Fols. 71vb-72rb: The Virgin Mary permitted to a woman at Qaḥra who lost her nine children to give birth to three children.

I-3)-52. Fols. 72rb-73ra: The Virgin Mary and the man called Baruch of Finəqi (BMirMA 40-41; BHMirM 83-84; CerMaria 514-516; ColMirM 60-61 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-26; éth. 60, fols. 43v-44v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-27; Orient. 8814, fols. 149v-150r, StrBritLib 48, no. 32, 16.-26).

I-3)-53 Fols. 73ra-73va: The Virgin Mary and the peasant called Ildefonsus (Däqəsyos).

I-3)-54. Fols. 73va-75ra: The vision of a man called ˀAbbas.

I-3)-55. Fols. 75ra-82vb: Andrew, priest of Cesarea (Qisərya) who could recite only one office (BMirMA 332-33; CerMaria 29, 38).

I-3)-56. Fols. 76ra-82vb: Apparition of the Virgin Mary at Däbrä Məṭmaq accompanied by martyrs and saints (ColMirM 197-201).

I-3)-57. Fols. 82vb-83vb: The Annunciation, the day of Hosanna (Hośaˁəna), the death of the Christ, the discourse of Mary to the disciples about the apparition of Jesus Christ: Miracle read during the day of Hosanna (Gəbrä Ḥəmamat, zäˁəlät Hośaˁəna, Addis Abäba, 1942 E.C., p. 21-22).

I-3)-58. Fols. 83vb-84vb: Samuel of Wəldəbba (gädamä Wali) received from the Virgin Mary a blessing in the form of a pearl (ˁənqwa baḥrəy) (mss. EMML 4618, fols. 118v-119r, EMML X 239, no. 4618-91).

I-3)-59. Fols. 84vb-85va: The Virgin Mary and the starving man.

I-3)-60. Fols. 85va-86rb: The Virgin Mary saved the soul of a murder who washed himself in the spring created by Jesus at the Virgin´s feet.

I-3)-61. Fols. 86rb-87vb: During the journey in Egypt, Jesus Christ raised a spring which cured the daughter of a brigand called Yosafəṭ (mss. éth 60, fols. 139-140, ZotBNat 66, no. 81).

I-3)-62. Fol. 88ra: end of a unidentified miracle

I-3)-63. Fol. 88rb-90ra: The story of the Ark of the Covenant (Tabotä Sion).

I-3)-64. Fols. 90ra-92rb: The story of the Ark of the Covenant (Tabotä Sion): Asqälona (Ascalon), Philistine (ˀIlofəli).

I-3)-65. Fols. 92rb-94ra: The story of the Ark of the Covenant (Tabotä Sion): Aminadab, Philistine (ˀIlofəli).

I-3)-66. Fols. 94ra-96rb: The birth of the Virgin Mary (Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase (ed.), Täˀamrä Maryam, Addis Abäba, 1956 E.C., p. 23-27).

I-3)-67. Fols. 96va-98va: The conception of the Virgin Mary: A dove, Joachim (ˀIyaqem) and his wife Ann (Ḥanna).

I-3)-68. Fols. 98va-101rb: The entrance of the Virgin Mary into the Temple with her parents, Joachim and Ann when she was three years old and twelve years old (BLedMH 127-129 variations).

I-3)-69. Fols. 101rb-105vb: Apparition of Gabriel to the Virgin Mary after she took a purple curtain in the Temple in front of the high priest Zacharia, and announcement of her pregnancy (BLedMH 129- ? variations).

I-3)-70. Fols. 105vb-108va: The birth of the Holy Saviour in Bethlehem.

I-3)-71. Fols. 108va-110vb: About the departure of the Virgin Mary: The angel Gabriel brings St. John to the Virgin Mary (mss. éth. 60, fol. 159, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-94).

I-3)-72. Fols. 110vb-112rb: About the departure of the Virgin Mary: The Jew Täfonyas tried to break the bed of the Virgin Mary (mss. éth. 60, fols.153-154, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-90).

I-3)-73. Fols. 112va-113vb: The Assumption of the Virgin Mary.

I-3)-74. Fols. 113vb-115rb: About the departure of the Virgin Mary: How Jesus acted as priest during the day of the Assumption in giving holy communion to the Apostles (mss. éth. 60, fol. 163, ZotBNat 67, no. 60-97).

I-3)-75. Fols. 115rb-117rb: The Virgin received a visit of an angel who asked her to go to the Mount of Olives (Däbrä Zayt).

I-3)-76. Fols. 117rb-118va: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to the Apostles (Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase (ed.), Täˀamrä Maryam, Addis Abäba, 1956 E.C, p. 101-103).

I-3)-77. Fol. 118va-121vb: Emperor Tiberius (Ṭibaryos) and the resurrection of his son (mss. éth. 62, fols. 50v-53v, ZotBNat 69, no. 62-34; d´Abbadie 165, fols. 65v-67v, CRAbb 81, no. 52-LX, AbbCat 174-175)

I-3)-78. Fol. 121vb-124vb: The Virgin Mary, Emperor Tiberius (Ṭibaryos) and St. John (mss. éth. 62, fols. 53v-55, ZotBNat 69, no. 62-35; d’Abbadie 165, fols. 67v-69v, CRAbb 81, no. 52-LXI, AbbCat 174-175).

I-3)-79. Fols. 124vb-125vb: The king Naˀod went to the land of Kuzara to plunder it.

literature.text: EAE IV, “Täʾammǝrä Iyasus”; W. WITAKOWSKI, “The Miracles of Jesus: An Ethiopian Apocryphal Gospel”, Apocrypha 6, 1995, 279-298.

desccontent.details:
II-1) Fol. 126r-128r: Glorification of Salome (GrébMJ I 589-591 // mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 16ra-16vb, StrBritLib 19, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 10va-11rb, GrébGriaule I, 55, no. 17);
II-2) Fol. 128r-131v: The fish stolen from a fisherman of Tiberias (GrébMJ I  646-649 // mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 28vb-30va, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 14ra-14vb, GrébGriaule I, 56, no. 17);
II-3) Fol. 131v-133v: The theft of an heifer in Galila (GréMJ II 775-779 // mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 30va-32ra, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 14vb-15va, GrébGriaule I, 56, no. 17);
II-4) Fol. 133v-135v: The lions of Ascalon (GréMJ III 821-824 // mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 32ra-33vb, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 38va-39ra, GrébGriaule I, 61, no. 17);
II-5) Fol. 135v-138r: The resurrection of the widow of Naim´s son (GréMJ II 827-831 // mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 48va-50ra, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 28ra-28vb, GrébGriaule I, 58, no. 17);
II-6) Fol. 144r-144v: The healing of a man deaf, dumb and blind (GréMJ II 823-827 // mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 46vb-48va, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 27rb-28ra, GrébGriaule I, 58, no. 17).

II-1) About a pious king who accept to be a priest in the land of Roḥa.

III-2) About a believer in a church dedicated to Qirqos.
III-3) About a poor monk from a distant country.
III-4) About a monk called Eli (ˀElyas).

desccontent.text: IV. End of an unidentified text
V. Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…”

edition.text: A. BAUSI, La vita e i miracoli di Libanos, Lovanii 2003 (CSCO 595-596 [SAe 105-106]): 86-87 (text), 53-54 (trans.).

colophon.det: The note is written in hand a (Zä-Wäldä Maryam).

additional.add: Fol. 142rb: አነ፡ ዘአጽሐፍኩ፡ ተ˂አምሪ˃ሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሕፃን፡ ፬˂…˃ዑኒ

extras.extra: - The title ተም፡ ማርያም is written upside down on the front board with black modern paint. - Unreadable note in the bottom margin: fol. 143.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper margin, - in the main hand: fols. 1r: ፩, 89r: ፪, 97r: ፫, 105r: ፬, 111r:፭, 119r:፮ - in a recent hand: 15r: ፫, 23r: ፬, 31r: ፭, 39r: ፮, 47r: ፯, 57r: ፰, 65r: ፱, 76r: ፲, 88r: ፩, 105r: ፪, 118r: ፫.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts and other occasions written in the upper margin, in the main hand Fol. 15r: ወሶበ፡ ጸሐፈ፡ ደቅስዮስ። በሚካኤል፡ ምንባብ Fol. 19r: በቅ[n.l.]፡ አድኅኖ፡ ለበላዒ Fol. 19v: በደናግል፡ ምንባብ Fol. 20v: ዘዓንቅዓ፡ ማይ Fol. 21r: በቅደሴ፡ ቤታ Fol. 23r: በልደታ፡ ወበደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ምንባብ Fol. 33r: አኮኑ፡ ብእሲ Fol. 33v: ሰበ፡ ወሀበኪ፡ ዘልፈ Fol. 34v: አብራዊ፡ ብፁዕ Fol. 35r: ለድምያኖስ፡ ዘጸሞጺኪ (?) Fol. 36r: አመ፡ እዴሁ፡ መተረ፡ ነሢኦ Fol. 37r: ይስሐቅ፡ መነኮስ Fol. 38r: ዘአትሎኪያ፡ ማ Fol. 39r: ምስለ፡ ዓራቱ፡ ዘዕፅ Fol. 39v: ዓፀደ፡ ማርያም Fol. 41r: ዘካርያስ፡ መሬዛ Fol. 42r: አረባውያን፡ እደው Fol. 43r: ኃይለኪ፡ ጽኑዓ፡ ወመንከረኪ Fol. 44r: ተወኪፈኪ፡ ስእለቶ፡ እ፡፡ (?) Fol. 44v: ሕደወት፡ ሐመማን Fol. 56r: በተንሣኤ፡ ምንባብ Fol. 59v: በገሪማ፡ ምንባብ Fol. 63v: በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ አንብብ Fol. 65r: በሚካኤል፡ ምንባብ Fol. 69v: በዓርብ፡ ስቅለት Fol. 73v: በማኅሌት፡ ምንባብ Fol. 76r: በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ምንባብ Fol. 82v: በሆሣዕና፡ ምንባብ Fol. 83v: በሳሙኤል፡ ምንባብ Fol. 85v: አንቅዓ፡ እምታሕተ፡ እግራ Fol. 86r: በልደታ፡ ምንባብ Fol. 88v: በጽዮን Fol. 96v: በቊጽረታ / ዘልደታ፡ እ፩ለግንቦት Fol. 98v: በበአታ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ Fol. 101r: በገብርኤል Fol. 105v: በልደቱ፡ ለመድኃኒነ Fol. 108v: በአስተርእዮ Fol. 112v: በሞታ፡ በፍልሰታ Fol. 113v: በፍልሰታ፡ Fol. 115r: በሕንጸታ፡ በቅዳሴ Fol. 117r: በሕንጸታ። Fol. 118v: በመስቀል Fol. 124v: በሚካኤል.
